Metadata.title: Craft D3 Charts for React - Vizzy
Metadata.description: A fully customizable, low-level visualization library powered by D3 and styled with Tailwind.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.welcome: Welcome to Vizzy documentation. This guide will help you get started with our powerful charting library that combines the flexibility of D3.js with the modern features of React.

ownership.title: Your Code, Your Control
ownership.description: Copy and paste what you need, then customize freely without dependency constraints.

modern.title: Modern Stack
modern.description: Built with React + D3.js + Tailwind CSS for beautiful, responsive visualizations.

flexible.title: Flexible Design
flexible.description: Start with sensible defaults, then customize the implementation and design separately.

responsive.title: Responsive by Default
responsive.description: Charts automatically adapt to any screen size with smooth animations.

typescript.title: TypeScript Ready
typescript.description: Full TypeScript support with well-documented props and utilities.

philosophy.title: Philosophy
philosophy.description: Vizzy is not a traditional component library. Instead of installing a dependency, you copy and paste the components you need. This gives you complete control over your charts.

why.title: Why this approach?
why.description: Traditional chart libraries often couple style with implementation. By providing copy-paste components:

benefits.control: Full control over implementation and design
benefits.dependencies: No version conflicts or dependency management
benefits.learning: Learn and modify the code as you use it
benefits.bundle: Only include what you need, reducing bundle size
benefits.future: Future-proof: your charts won't break from upstream changes
benefits.security: Better security: review code once, no need to trust external package updates

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Get started with Vizzy in your React project.

installation.title: Installation
installation.intro: Get started with Vizzy in minutes. A modern React charting library built with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS.

init.title: Create Project
init.description: Initialize a new Vizzy project with all dependencies pre-configured.

add.title: Add Chart
add.description: Generate a new chart component. Choose from our collection of beautiful, customizable charts.

features.types: Supports: line-chart, bar-chart, donut-chart, stacked-bar-chart, stream-chart, and tree-map

lineChart.title: Line Chart
lineChart.description: A versatile line chart perfect for visualizing trends over time, showing continuous data changes, and comparing multiple series of data.

barChart.title: Bar Chart
barChart.description: A powerful bar chart for comparing categorical data, displaying distributions, and highlighting differences between groups.

examplesPage.title: Examples Gallery
examplesPage.description: Preview real components copied directly from the repo's /examples folder. Each card renders the live React component so you can see animations, tooltips, and theming options before copying anything into your product.
examplesPage.ctaDescription: Step-by-step instructions for running every example locally.

basicBar.title: Basic Bar Chart
basicBar.description: A minimalist comparison chart with labeled axes and optional legend.

donut.title: Donut Composition
donut.description: Visualize part-to-whole breakdowns with animated slices and labels.

stacked.title: Stacked Bar Series
stacked.description: Show composition and totals per category with stacked segments.

stream.title: Streaming Areas
stream.description: Animate flowing areas for multi-series timelines.

tree.title: Treemap Allocation
tree.description: Summarize nested categories with responsive rectangles.

interactiveLine.title: Interactive Line Demo
interactiveLine.description: Advanced example with hover tooltips, focus states, and vibe selector.
